intro: Manihot angustifrons, commonly known as the narrow-leaf arrowleaf, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive arrowhead-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically greenish or yellowish in color. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in humid lowland areas. Due to its ornamental value and adaptability, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
